backend

Class PeripheralManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • backend.PeripheralManager

  • public class PeripheralManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Global class used to detect and import evidence files located on peripheral devices (cameras, USB drives, etc.).
    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Jacob Jones, Andrew Rottier

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PeripheralManager.OSType
      Values used to represent the current operating system.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Device> devices 
      private PeripheralManager.OSType os 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PeripheralManager()
      Populates instance fields by scanning the computer for external media devices.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<Device> getDevices()
      Returns an ArrayList of Device objects representing the peripheral devices currently connected to the computer.
      PeripheralManager.OSType getOS()
      Returns an OSType enum value representing the operating system that the JVM is currently running on.
      void refreshDevices()
      Reloads the devices ArrayList, scanning the system for valid external devices once again.
      private java.util.ArrayList<Device> retrieveDevices()
      Operating system dependent method that scans the system for and stores information about any external devices.
      private PeripheralManager.OSType retrieveOS()
      Determines which operating system is currently being used by pulling the os.name system property.
      private boolean validateDevice(java.io.File file)
      Returns a boolean value indicating whether or not the passed in File is a valid peripheral device.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getOS

        public PeripheralManager.OSType getOS()
        Returns an OSType enum value representing the operating system that the JVM is currently running on.
        Returns:
        OSType enum value representing the operating system that the JVM is currently running on

      • getDevices

        public java.util.ArrayList<Device> getDevices()
        Returns an ArrayList of Device objects representing the peripheral devices currently connected to the computer.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Device objects representing the peripheral devices currently connected to the computer

      • refreshDevices

        public void refreshDevices()
        Reloads the devices ArrayList, scanning the system for valid external devices once again.

      • retrieveOS

        private PeripheralManager.OSType retrieveOS()
        Determines which operating system is currently being used by pulling the os.name system property.
        Returns:
        OSType.WINDOWS, OSType.OSX, or OSType.OTHER (self explanatory)

      • retrieveDevices

        private java.util.ArrayList<Device> retrieveDevices()
        Operating system dependent method that scans the system for and stores information about any external devices.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Device objects representing the currently connected peripheral devices

      • validateDevice

        private boolean validateDevice(java.io.File file)
        Returns a boolean value indicating whether or not the passed in File is a valid peripheral device.
        Parameters:
        file - the File in question
        Returns:
        true if the passed in File is a valid peripheral device; false if otherwise
